post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Ah Kat hey!

I can't remeber my exaxt details, but I've been as "audio" as you're visual.

I found it pretty surprising - I always thought I'm oh so visual, but now I start to understand why I dislike people who tend to choose wrong words while meaning the right thing.

I'll give it a try some time later in the future.

There are some interesting personality tests here as well:
http://www.emode.com

Some of the outcomings are scary but somehow true.

Good that we can't look at our real destiny.

post.author: kat
post.body:
looks like some interesting stuff on that site..! All this stuff reminds me of a 'compatability test' I did when at school as it was used to guide you in the direction of a possible career, at the time I could have been a park ranger (which I quite liked the idea of being..!)

I often think it's funny that although these things are devised as 'general guide' to personality it amazing how we all seem to fit into one or more catagories/pigeon holes when we tend to think we so individual, very interesting stuff imho..

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Yes dammit!

I also think of myself as highly individual and unique, but I fit perfectely into 80% of every test.

Park ranger? Hey - why not! At least you can walk around with a dog and a gun which is always considered as pretty manly.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

I often think it's funny that although these things are devised as 'general guide' to personality it amazing how we all seem to fit into one or more catagories/pigeon holes when we tend to think we so individual, very interesting stuff imho..

post.author: BNA!
post.body:

Park ranger? Hey - why not! At least you can walk around with a dog and a gun which is always considered as pretty manly.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Ah Kat hey!

I can't remeber my exaxt details, but I've been as "audio" as you're visual.

I found it pretty surprising - I always thought I'm oh so visual, but now I start to understand why I dislike people who tend to choose wrong words while meaning the right thing.

I'll give it a try some time later in the future.

There are some interesting personality tests here as well:
http://www.emode.com

Some of the outcomings are scary but somehow true.

Good that we can't look at our real destiny.

post.author: kat
post.body:
looks like some interesting stuff on that site..! All this stuff reminds me of a 'compatability test' I did when at school as it was used to guide you in the direction of a possible career, at the time I could have been a park ranger (which I quite liked the idea of being..!)

I often think it's funny that although these things are devised as 'general guide' to personality it amazing how we all seem to fit into one or more catagories/pigeon holes when we tend to think we so individual, very interesting stuff imho..

post.author: BNA!

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

anyways, i always thought myself to be strongly left brained. mostly because I have olmost no usage of my left hand/arm and left leg. that is, its not like i'm paralyzed or anything actually physically. its things like kicking a ball with my left leg is near impossible to control. or if i were to throw a ball with my left arm. post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Ah Kat hey!

I can't remeber my exaxt details, but I've been as "audio" as you're visual.

I found it pretty surprising - I always thought I'm oh so visual, but now I start to understand why I dislike people who tend to choose wrong words while meaning the right thing.

I'll give it a try some time later in the future.

There are some interesting personality tests here as well:
http://www.emode.com

Some of the outcomings are scary but somehow true.

Good that we can't look at our real destiny.

post.author: kat
post.body:
looks like some interesting stuff on that site..! All this stuff reminds me of a 'compatability test' I did when at school as it was used to guide you in the direction of a possible career, at the time I could have been a park ranger (which I quite liked the idea of being..!)

I often think it's funny that although these things are devised as 'general guide' to personality it amazing how we all seem to fit into one or more catagories/pigeon holes when we tend to think we so individual, very interesting stuff imho..

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Yes dammit!

I also think of myself as highly individual and unique, but I fit perfectely into 80% of every test.

Park ranger? Hey - why not! At least you can walk around with a dog and a gun which is always considered as pretty manly.

post.author: jvd
post.body: auditory 69.2 / visual 30.8 , left 47.6/ right 52.4

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: Qwertys
post.body:
I'm too lazy to post my scores. that test hurt my brain. I was like "WTF?!^^"
anyways, i always thought myself to be strongly left brained. mostly because I have olmost no usage of my left hand/arm and left leg. that is, its not like i'm paralyzed or anything actually physically. its things like kicking a ball with my left leg is near impossible to control. or if i were to throw a ball with my left arm. It just feels quite unnatural.
Of course, my personality traits would say otherwise.

I might take it agian when i'm more tired and confused.
Try the Emode tests though, they are quite good.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: jvd
post.body: eyes open lamp is covered by my finger , left eye lamp is visiable , right eye it is covered by my finger

post.author: White Hat
post.body:
Left brain 68.2 %

Right Brain 31.8 %

Auditory 50%
Visual 50%

anybody else have that high of percent for left brain?

post.author: juve
post.body:
the eyes are connected to both hemispheres ! It wont change much if you close one.

My "balanced" Brain:


and "auditory" does not have to do anything with audio, then it imho would be auditive.
it comes from "to audit" or "audit" (grap a dictionary if you don't know what it means)

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
juve wrote:
and "auditory" does not have to do anything with audio, then it imho would be auditive.
it comes from "to audit" or "audit" (grap a dictionary if you don't know what it means)


Auditory means everything related to hearing.
Doesn't come the car brand "Audi" from "Horch" being translated into Latin

post.author: juve
post.body:
...deleted...
quite stupid, will better go to bed now

post.author: juve
post.body:
OK you are right.

"HARM and CHARM" -> audio

Sorry, next time will hopefully think a little longer before i write something.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
bb_matt wrote:
To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.


This is a exerpt from "billards 101". It sounds like your teaching people how to play 8 ball.

59.1 right
50 auditiory
50 visual

btw, this proggy must be like 10 years old at least, cause i remember using it when i was 6 or 7 on the old 386 and now i'm 16.5. Then i scored 50/50/50/50.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: Qwertys
post.body:
I'm too lazy to post my scores. that test hurt my brain. I was like "WTF?!^^"
anyways, i always thought myself to be strongly left brained. mostly because I have olmost no usage of my left hand/arm and left leg. that is, its not like i'm paralyzed or anything actually physically. its things like kicking a ball with my left leg is near impossible to control. or if i were to throw a ball with my left arm. It just feels quite unnatural.
Of course, my personality traits would say otherwise.

I might take it agian when i'm more tired and confused.
Try the Emode tests though, they are quite good.

basically what this translates too is that I'm fucking average.

thanks for listening to my drunken post.

bb_matt wrote:
To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.


This is a exerpt from "billards 101". It sounds like your teaching people how to play 8 ball.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: Qwertys
post.body:
I'm too lazy to post my scores. that test hurt my brain. I was like "WTF?!^^"
anyways, i always thought myself to be strongly left brained. mostly because I have olmost no usage of my left hand/arm and left leg. that is, its not like i'm paralyzed or anything actually physically. its things like kicking a ball with my left leg is near impossible to control. or if i were to throw a ball with my left arm. It just feels quite unnatural.
Of course, my personality traits would say otherwise.

I might take it agian when i'm more tired and confused.
Try the Emode tests though, they are quite good.

dude...
i'm so drunk right now. i'm so drunk it would bring my IQ down to the general american level. WOAH, thats drunk, and that would mean an IQ of like 50... hahaha. werd, this is so fun. and now i'm off to play a game of starcraft. but unlike the general american public i'm drunk because it was a friends birthday party. how bout you europeans. what makes you drunk. i know in some countries its legal to smoke pot, so what about that?

thanks for listening to my drunken post.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

I know that not the same results have been achieved each time I used this test.

post.author: kat
post.body:
looks like some interesting stuff on that site..! All this stuff reminds me of a 'compatability test' I did when at school as it was used to guide you in the direction of a possible career, at the time I could have been a park ranger (which I quite liked the idea of being..!)

I often think it's funny that although these things are devised as 'general guide' to personality it amazing how we all seem to fit into one or more catagories/pigeon holes when we tend to think we so individual, very interesting stuff imho..

post.author: jvd

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Ah Kat hey!

I can't remeber my exaxt details, but I've been as "audio" as you're visual.

I found it pretty surprising - I always thought I'm oh so visual, but now I start to understand why I dislike people who tend to choose wrong words while meaning the right thing.

I'll give it a try some time later in the future.

There are some interesting personality tests here as well:
http://www.emode.com

Some of the outcomings are scary but somehow true.

Good that we can't look at our real destiny.

post.author: kat
post.body:
looks like some interesting stuff on that site..! All this stuff reminds me of a 'compatability test' I did when at school as it was used to guide you in the direction of a possible career, at the time I could have been a park ranger (which I quite liked the idea of being..!)

I often think it's funny that although these things are devised as 'general guide' to personality it amazing how we all seem to fit into one or more catagories/pigeon holes when we tend to think we so individual, very interesting stuff imho..

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Yes dammit!

I also think of myself as highly individual and unique, but I fit perfectely into 80% of every test.

Park ranger? Hey - why not! At least you can walk around with a dog and a gun which is always considered as pretty manly.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: jvd
post.body: eyes open lamp is covered by my finger , left eye lamp is visiable , right eye it is covered by my finger

post.author: White Hat
post.body:
Left brain 68.2 %

Right Brain 31.8 %

Auditory 50%
Visual 50%

anybody else have that high of percent for left brain?

post.author: juve
post.body:
the eyes are connected to both hemispheres ! It wont change much if you close one.

My "balanced" Brain:


and "auditory" does not have to do anything with audio, then it imho would be auditive.
it comes from "to audit" or "audit" (grap a dictionary if you don't know what it means)

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
juve wrote:
and "auditory" does not have to do anything with audio, then it imho would be auditive.
it comes from "to audit" or "audit" (grap a dictionary if you don't know what it means)


Auditory means everything related to hearing.
Doesn't come the car brand "Audi" from "Horch" being translated into Latin

post.author: juve
post.body:
...deleted...
quite stupid, will better go to bed now

post.author: juve
post.body:
OK you are right.

"HARM and CHARM" -> audio

Sorry, next time will hopefully think a little longer before i write something.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
bb_matt wrote:
To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.


This is a exerpt from "billards 101". It sounds like your teaching people how to play 8 ball.

59.1 right
50 auditiory
50 visual

btw, this proggy must be like 10 years old at least, cause i remember using it when i was 6 or 7 on the old 386 and now i'm 16.5. Then i scored 50/50/50/50.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: Qwertys
post.body:
I'm too lazy to post my scores. that test hurt my brain. I was like "WTF?!^^"
anyways, i always thought myself to be strongly left brained. mostly because I have olmost no usage of my left hand/arm and left leg. that is, its not like i'm paralyzed or anything actually physically. its things like kicking a ball with my left leg is near impossible to control. or if i were to throw a ball with my left arm. It just feels quite unnatural.
Of course, my personality traits would say otherwise.

I might take it agian when i'm more tired and confused.
Try the Emode tests though, they are quite good.

basically what this translates too is that I'm fucking average.

thanks for listening to my drunken post.

bb_matt wrote:
To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.


This is a exerpt from "billards 101". It sounds like your teaching people how to play 8 ball.

post.author: karminax
post.body:
The test often presents you different questions, so I did it three times. Results:
1.: 66% left, 66% auditory
2.: 58% left, 75% visual
3.: 77% right, 78% visual

I admit that 2nd/3rd run was a bit quicker and perhaps more spontaneous, but I cannot say I answered "against my brain".
Now the funny thing is that the personal evaluations for ALL three results were quite appealing in the sense that I could indentify with many or most of the stuff.

So here's my question for the author of the test:
"Which of the following three words do you like most:"
(a) Horoscope
(b) Popularism
(c) Crap

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
Hey - your speaking to one of the masters of the drunken post here !

God knows I've posted some outrageous and stupid things in the past whilst under the influence of booze and now and then combined with the old waccy-baccy.

waccy-baccy - it's so widely used in this country, it's ridiculous. We still have some strict laws, but they are getting more liberal about it. You can now be caught smoking or in the possession of maybe 2 or 3 joints and you'll just get a warning - they won't even confiscate your stuff.

Dunno about Europe, but drinking where I live is a big passtime and a source of jokes of the variety of "I got so hammered last night I....." type thing.

I tried an IQ test whilst inebriated once and suffice to say, I went down from the 130's to the 90's

Perhaps that's why I like getting drunk

"So you ride yourselves over the fields and
you make all your animal deals and
your wise men don't know how it feels to be thick as a brick."

post.author: rich_is_bored

I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

I took this braintest and it gave an inaccurate result. I am clearly a visually oriented person yet I am somehow also stikingly auditory as well.

I've been diagnosed by many doctors and they all came up with the same conclusion. I think this little fad thing is a piece of junk.

edit:

I apologize for my outburst. It's just that, there was this one class in school I had where the teacher wanted to determine the best approach to the teaching of each individual student. I was gauged as an auditory student.

I know that not the same results have been achieved each time I used this test.

post.author: CrUsH

I was 33 percent Visual and 67 percent auditory.

And my right hemisphere was dominating over my left.

post.body:
I think there is some confusion here that I need to clear up...

"Bush is the sheeit! You teach dem muslims what for! Yeehaw!" said the ignorant masses.

"Why vote when electoral votes are all that count and you have to choose between puppet #1 and puppet #2?" said the informed few.

Anyway, someone take the silly brain test and post your results.

post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
To hijack this thread further...

Yeah no kidding. While I always vote, I can understand peoples' disenchantment with the supposed thing we US Americans call "democracy". R's and D's are so alike in their desire to line their pockets and cow-tow to big businesses (where the real power lies in the US) that I can hardly stomach voting for a Dem just to get a certain "rich white boy who has failed at everything all his life but had a rich white daddy to bail him out at every turn" out of office. And that as$hole is against affirmative action... rofl. His whole life has been a case study in it! Of course, we just don't call rich white boy privilege anything, because that might muck up the assumption that rich white brats are entitled to everything they didn't earn. But I digress....

Of course, things are changing. I give talks on US foreign policy in my spare time (yes, seriously... hey, someone's got to do it) and last year was the first time the NY Times was forced to say something like, "There may still be two superpowers on the planet: the United States and world public opinion" (2/17/03). It's pretty much unprecedented for such a mainstream partyline-toting paper to have to acknowledge world public opinion so blatantly. Usually it's marginalized to a much greater extent. Similarly, while anti-war folks like myself were unable to prevent the Bush administration from carrying out their plans, it was amazing to have the overwhelming majority of the world, let alone hundreds of thousands in the US, protest a war before it even broke out. Recall that it took several years and the deaths of thousands of US troops before people cared about or protested Viet Nam.

But anyway...

*ahem*

So... that brain test thingy....

Goliath

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Ah Kat hey!

I can't remeber my exaxt details, but I've been as "audio" as you're visual.

I found it pretty surprising - I always thought I'm oh so visual, but now I start to understand why I dislike people who tend to choose wrong words while meaning the right thing.

I'll give it a try some time later in the future.

There are some interesting personality tests here as well:
http://www.emode.com

Some of the outcomings are scary but somehow true.

Good that we can't look at our real destiny.

post.author: kat
post.body:
looks like some interesting stuff on that site..! All this stuff reminds me of a 'compatability test' I did when at school as it was used to guide you in the direction of a possible career, at the time I could have been a park ranger (which I quite liked the idea of being..!)

I often think it's funny that although these things are devised as 'general guide' to personality it amazing how we all seem to fit into one or more catagories/pigeon holes when we tend to think we so individual, very interesting stuff imho..

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
left 40.9 / right 59.1
auditory 40 / visual 60

I pretty much knew it would work out that way for me - fairly decent at art and design and good with sound, but only average at math.

Interesting side note - I went clay pigeon shooting the other day for the first time (never really shot a gun before) - there's a dominant eye in shooting and I wonder whether it relates to your left / right brain hemispheres ?

To test, point at a distant object - even across the room, as long as it's over 10 feet away (the further the better)
Now, close your right eye - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?
Close your right and open your left - does the object you are pointing at 'move' ?

Whichever eye that doesn't see the object move, if your dominant eye and one you should always use when aiming.
